description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3f0if","text":"This process involves bacterial conjugation, where a conjugative plasmid found in one bacterial strain facilitates the transfer of a mobilizable plasmid from a second bacterial strain to a third bacterial strain. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5c5rf","text":"In the method from our lab, CC118λpir containing a pSEVA plasmid works as the donor, the E. coli 1047 pRK2013 strand is the helper, and the receiver is a C. rodentium strand.\n","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":89,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":154,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Insertion of he suicide plasmid by three partner conjugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2vlrd","text":"Place 20 µl spots of the helper and donor strains onto an LB plate (no antibiotics) and an additional spot of 20 µl of the helper on top of 20 µl of the donor (D+H).","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":110,"length":54}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fq356","text":"Leave the plate open at the flame until the spots get dry. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6dmf","text":"Add 40 µl of the receiver strain on top of the D+H spot (D+H+R) and an additional 20 µl spot of this strain alone. Wait for the spot to get dry and incubate for     facing up.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":59}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":161,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":163,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d789m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Insertion of he suicide plasmid by three partner conjugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d7ojo","text":"Collect the 4 patches using a sterile loop and resuspend each of them in 1 ml of LB in an eppendorf.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Insertion of he suicide plasmid by three partner conjugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bhp6a","text":"Plate 100 µl of each tube in LB plates supplemented with Gm + Sm.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Insertion of he suicide plasmid by three partner conjugation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"238o7","text":"Centrifuge the rest of the D+H+R tube at   to pellet the cells, resuspend in 100 µl and plate as well.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c3vl8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"2000","duration":120,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

Second recombination for a scarless genomic modification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b63h3","text":"Pick two colonies of the D+H+R plate and grow them in LB+Sm + L-arabinose broth at 0.4% for a minimum of   for the induction of the I-SceI endonuclease of the pACBSR plasmid.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":62,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":105,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":105,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2t8d5","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64c68","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fo14m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"923ji","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":21600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":7}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e6tr5","text":"In the   plates with only donor, helper or receiver no colonies should grow.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ajkgb","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"duration":21600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"}},"guid":"C5C3F408F4BF46148ECE34C9A7783FFB"}}}}

steps.section: Second recombination for a scarless genomic modification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b74vq","text":"Insert the inoculation loop in the culture and streak on LB+Sm plates to obtain individual colonies. Incubate the plates   at 37°C.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":121,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"A50FD249D6F911EEBA4A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Second recombination for a scarless genomic modification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"84a83","text":"The next day, pick some colonies and patch them on a LB+Sm plate and on a LB+Sm+Gm plate. Incubate the plates   at 37°C.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":53,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":74,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":110,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"201pt","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk7si","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"65nua","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"A50FD249D6F911EEBA4A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dqkcd","text":"Colonies that do not grow on the plate with Gm are those that have recombined after treatment with the endonuclease I-SceI.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"AE849FB915F242F58A2ADE78B8E74429"}}}}

steps.section: Second recombination for a scarless genomic modification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8osvo","text":"Analyze by PCR and gel electrophoresis those colonies which have grown on LB+Sm but not on LB+Sm+Gm to differentiate the modified colonies from the ones which have reverted to the Wild-Type genotype. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adiob","text":"NOTE: The primers should hybridise outside of the homology regions selected. Upon analysis of 10 colonies you should get a about 50% of modified colonies.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Second recombination for a scarless genomic modification
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cvbuq","text":"NOTE: To remove the pACBSR plasmid, make 8-9 passes of the strain without Sm in liquid LB. Plate the last culture in LB plates and patch individual colonies the following day on LB and LB+Sm plates to select those sensitive to the antibiotic.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Triparental mating with pSEVA protocol
